results.title: Isabella and the magic brush (K)
results.brief_description: An animated fantasy, adapted from a Chinese fairytale, about a young girl whose desire to be an artist is thwarted by poverty, a tyrant king, and her parents, until she receives a magic brush. Animated by Barbara Dourmashkin, narrated by Alice Playton. Suitable for primary school level.
results.description: An animated fantasy, adapted from a Chinese fairytale, about a young girl whose desire to be an artist is thwarted by poverty, a tyrant king, and her parents, until she receives a magic brush. results.title: Isaac Newton
results.brief_description: Re-enacts Sir Isaac Newton’s research in the fields of mathematics, including the development of his binomial theorem, differential and integral calculus, theories relating to light, and his laws of gravitation and motion. Shows how his work altered the course of physical sciences and mathematics.

results.title: Isaac Button: country potter
results.creator_credit: J M Anderson Films, Films for Potters, John Anderson and Robert Fournier
results.brief_description: The film records the skill of the last potter working at Soil Hill Pottery near Halifax. This was one of the few potteries making thrown vessels to survive into the 1960’s.
results.creator_credit_for_label: J M Anderson Films, Films for Potters, John Anderson and Robert Fournier

results.title: Is this the job for me? No. 7. Light repetitive work
results.brief_description: The film shows the work performed by women in a factory where food is mass-produced. Mass production applies to many other articles besides food, the principles being the same. The work is divided into simple processes, one person doing one thing, usually sitting down. Women in this type of industry may expect good pay for the work, social facilities and medical attention.
results.title_for_label: Is this the job for me? No. 7. Light repetitive work
results.description: The film shows the work performed by women in a factory where food is mass-produced. Mass production applies to many other articles besides food, the principles being the same. results.title: Is this the job for me? No. 4. Making engines
results.brief_description: Shows the range of jobs in heavy engineering production of boilers, locomotives etc. Stresses the need for craftsmanship and training in this industry.

results.title: Is this the job for me: Jack of what trade
results.brief_description: This film is intended as a guide to young people of school leaving age who are faced with the problem of choosing a career. The film is a dramatised account of a school visit by a Youth Employment Officer, and his subsequent discussion with students and visits to industry. Suggests self-analysis by students to assess their special talents, interests, dispositions and physique in terms of their future employment.

results.title: Is this job for me? No. 5. Making boots and shoes
results.brief_description: Made for showing to children of school-leaving age. This film takes the student on a tour of a boot and shoe factory, illustrating firstly the methods by which a single craftsman makes a pair of shoes and then the way in which the same job is done using modern machinery.
